CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The J SC value calculated by integrating the IPCE data with an AM 1.5G reference spectrum is rather consistent with that obtained from J-V plots within 10% error.

Let's think step by step.

1. IPCE: Photonic Conversion Efficiency (or Incident Photonic to Current Efficiency)
2. AM 1.5G: Reference Solar Spectrum (specifically, the Air Mass 1.5 Global solar spectrum)
3. J-V: Junction Voltage (or Current-Voltage)
4. J SC: Short Circuit Current Density (or Short Circuit Current)

So, the Material Name entity is not explicitly mentioned in the paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.
There is no explicit mention of a Material Name in the paragraph.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| IPCE data |
| J-V plots |

Note: The paragraph does not explicitly mention a specific material name.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The J SC value calculated by integrating the IPCE data with an AM 1.5G reference spectrum is rather consistent with that obtained from J-V plots within 10% error.

Let's think step by step.

1. J SC: This is a specific property name referring to the short-circuit current density, which is a measure of the maximum current that a photovoltaic cell can generate under standard conditions.
2. IPCE data: This stands for "Internal Quantum Efficiency" data. It is a measure of the efficiency of a photovoltaic cell in converting incident light into electrical current internally within the device.
3. AM 1.5G reference spectrum: This is a standard solar spectrum used as a reference for measuring the performance of solar cells. It represents the solar spectrum at the Earth's surface under standard conditions.
4. J-V plots: These are graphs that represent the relationship between the current (I) and voltage (V) of a photovoltaic cell under different operating conditions. The J-V plots are used to determine the maximum power point and the efficiency of the cell.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

1. J SC: This is a material property referring to the short-circuit current density of a photovoltaic cell.
2. IPCE data: This is a material property referring to the Internal Quantum Efficiency of a photovoltaic cell.
3. J-V plots: While not a material property itself, J-V plots are used to determine material properties such as the maximum power point and efficiency of a photovoltaic cell.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| J SC (short-circuit current density) |
| IPCE data (Internal Quantum Efficiency) |
| J-V plots |

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The J SC value calculated by integrating the IPCE data with an AM 1.5G reference spectrum is rather consistent with that obtained from J-V plots within 10% error.

Let's think step by step.

1. J SC value: This is a specific property value, likely referring to the short-circuit current density, which is a key performance metric in photovoltaic cells.
2. IPCE data: This stands for "Internal Quantum Efficiency" data, which is a measure of the efficiency of a photovoltaic cell in converting incident light into electrical current internally.
3. AM 1.5G reference spectrum: This is a standard reference spectrum used in photovoltaic research and testing, representing the solar spectrum under standard test conditions.

So, the "Property Value" entities in the paragraph are:

1. J SC value
2. IPCE data
3. Efficiency (implied by "consistent with that obtained from J-V plots")
4. 10% error (though not a property value per se, it is a measure of the difference between two property values)
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. J SC value
2. IPCE data
3. Efficiency (as it is a material property, being a measure of the performance of a photovoltaic cell)

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| J SC value |
| IPCE data |
| Efficiency |
